How should the project manager avoid this situation in the future?

questions.question_text:
A project manager has a team of shared resources from other projects who are working on a client project. Three days before the project is due. The team informs the project manager that the project will be delayed because a component was not delivered on time. Competing priorities of the shared resources are delaying delivery of the component.
What should the project manager have done to prevent this delay from happening?

choices.A: Updated the risk management plan and registered lessons learned for the project
choices.C: Maintained constant communication with the stakeholders of the other projects
choices.B: Reorganized the team for the project based on the work breakdown structure (WBS)
choices.D: Used the resource management plan to identify the impacts of the other projects

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: C
I agree with C. The catchphrase here is informing the stakeholder three days before the expected date of delivery. The PM should have maintained constant communication and the stakeholder should have been prepared to expect delays.

Selected Answer: C
The most effective way to prevent this delay would have been for the project manager to maintain constant communication with the stakeholders of the other projects. This PROACTIVE (!) approach would have provided visibility into resource priorities, enabled negotiation or schedule adjustments, and ensured the component’s delivery stayed on track. In project management best practices (e.g., PMBOK), managing shared resources requires ongoing collaboration and stakeholder engagement—exactly what Option C entails.

Answer: C. Maintained constant communication with the stakeholders of the other projects

questions.question_text:
A project manager is assigned to a project that is in development. As the project manager reviews the project's progress, they find a few tasks that are behind schedule. After investigating, the project manager discovers that a few team members were pulled to work on other assignments, which impacted their ability to focus on the project manager's project.
Which two actions can the project manager take to bring the team back on track? (Choose two.)

choices.C: Alert the business stakeholders immediately of the schedule delay
choices.B: Allow the team members to catch up at their own pace
choices.D: Discuss the risk of project delay and work priorities with the respective functional managers
choices.E: Work with the team to identify options to accelerate project delivery.
choices.A: Establish daily standups to review project progress and track the completion of deliverables

- Get visibility into the project's progress
- Identify roadblocks and address them promptly

- Understand the reasons behind the team members' reassignment
- Negotiate the return of team members or secure additional resources
- Prioritize tasks and adjust the project schedule accordingly

Discussing the risk of project delay and work priorities with the respective functional managers can also help to bring the team back on track. comments.content: A daily standup is usually agile specific, this doesn't really specify that its agile or that would be a better answer. A daily standup could cause a lot of issues in a predictive environment like say, construction or something. Imagine you're a construction worker who has to drive to a meeting/connect a computer every day, wait for everyone to get in, hope it goes as planned, then get back into your headspace of working on a task. They can be counterproductive if there isn't a constant need for them.
